alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Avoyelles; Evangeline; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 11:30AM CST until January 24 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Avoyelles Parish in central Louisiana... Southeastern Evangeline Parish in central Louisiana... Northwestern St. Landry Parish in central Louisiana... Northeastern Acadia Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 145 PM CST. * At 1130 AM CST, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from earlier thunderstorm heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Opelousas, Eunice, Ville Platte, Church Point, Simmesport, Moreauville, Palmetto, Morrow, Bayou Current, Washington, Chataignier, Plaucheville, Whiteville, Grand Prairie, Lebeau, Big Cane, Goudeau, Prairie Ronde, Dupont and Lawtell. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
